questions.uddipok:
Read the following text and fill in each gap with a suitable word based on the information of the text:
Among the most significant causes of soil pollution is the enormous volume of industrial waste which is being produced every day but not disposed properly. The mismanagement of household wastes, particularly the polythene shopping bags, has caused serious threat to the soil and the drainage system. Another cause for soil pollution is the use of agricultural pesticides, fertilizers etc. Sometimes fuel leakages from automobiles may get washed away by rain and seep into the nearby soil.
Pesticides and fertilizers are useful for plant growth but their overuse has led to soil pollution. Natural fertilizers and compost can be used instead of their chemical alternatives. Recycling is another way to reduce and control soil pollution. Recycling papers, plastics and other materials reduces the volume of refuse in landfills. Deforestation also causes erosion, pollution and the loss of fertility in the topsoil. Planting trees and re-forestation help prevent soil erosion and pollution.
The large amount of industrial waste is greatly (a) ___ for the soil pollution. The randomly (b) ___ away polythene bags also cause a great threat to the soil and drainage system. The (c) ___ of pesticides, fertilizer, etc. in the field also (d) ___ the texture of the soil. Whatever may be the causes, we should try to (e) ___ soil pollution.

sub_questions.explanation: (a) responsible; (b) thrown; (c) use; (d) damage/ harm/spoil; (e) prevent/stop.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on "Early Rising".
(a) What is early rising? (b) What are the benefits of early rising? (c) Why is it important for students? (d) How does it help us do our works in time? (e) How can we develop the habit of early rising?

sub_questions.explanation:
Early Rising
Early rising is a positive habit. It means that we should get up from bed early in the morning to enable ourselves to be ready for a new day. This fact, when made into a regular habit, will surely lead us to a world of bliss and prosperity. A proverb says, "Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise." Early rising has many benefits. The man who rises early in the morning can take some exercises or a walk in the fresh air by the riverside or in the open field. It makes our minds fresh and lively. Early in the morning, nature seems quiet and calm. No hue and cry are heard then. Nature smiles in the morning with colourful flowers and green leaves. Birds begin to chirp. These beautiful gifts and colourful nature in the morning remind everybody of the Creator. One feels like praying to the Almighty: But it is not easy to attain this quality. Sleeping late at night does not help in early rising. So, to rise early from bed, we have to go to bed early. An early riser enjoys the surroundings very much and gets enough time to do his work either in study or in other work, which will bring him success. On the contrary, if one gets up late, the schedule of his work becomes interrupted. Above all, early rising keeps us healthy and cheerful. For all these reasons, we all should cultivate the habit of early rising.

questions.uddipok:
Read the beginning of a story. Add at least ten new sentences to complete the story.
Once upon a time, the house of a rich man was infested with rats. They were living happily creating a lot of troubles for the house owner………..

sub_questions.explanation:
Who's to Bell the Cat
Once upon a time, the house of a rich man was infested with rats. They were living there with great happiness without any fear. They were having a great fun and boldly moved in the house. But the inmates of the house were having a great trouble. One day, they brought a cat to kill the rats. The cat began to kill the rats every day. The rats became very afraid and helpless. They could not move freely. So, they held a meeting. They talked about the problems- but could not find out any solution. They became disappointed. At last, a little rat stood up and said, "If we tie a bell on the neck of the rat, we can know its presence and save ourselves by running away." All the rats became very happy. They began to dance in pleasure. Suddenly, an old rat said, "The idea is very good. But who will bell the cat?" Hearing it, all the rats became silent again.

questions.uddipok: The graphs show changes in spending habits of people living in Dhaka between 1971 and 2001. Summarize the information by selecting and reporting the main features and comparisons where relevant.

sub_questions.explanation: The given pie charts display the spending habits of people living in Dhaka during 2001 and 1971. A comparative study between the two charts shows how much people's habits have changed over the years. According to the charts, people used to spend 44 % 44 \% 44% of their budget on food in 1971. On the other hand, people started spending more on cars in 2001 and it took the lead with a record of 43 % 43 \% 43% spending. In comparison, people used to spend only 22 % 22 \% 22% on cars back in 1971 and only 14 % 14 \% 14% on food in 2001. It is evident that in 2001, people started spending 21 % 21 \% 21% more on cars and 30 % 30 \% 30% less on food. Looking at 1971's chart, we also see that people used to spend 10 % 10 \% 10% on petrol, 9 % 9 \% 9% on furniture, 7 % 7 \% 7% on restaurants, 6 % 6 \% 6% on books and 2 % 2 \% 2% on computers. Whereas people started spending 8 % 8 \% 8% on petrol, 8 % 8 \% 8% on furniture, 14 % 14 \% 14% on restaurants, 1 % 1 \% 1% on books and 12 % 12 \% 12% on computers in 2001. So, after analyzing the charts, it can be said that people started spending more on technologies in 2001.

questions.uddipok: Write a letter to your friend advising him to follow the rules of health.

sub_questions.explanation:
Mirpur- 12, Dhaka
August 15, 2024
Dear Abir,
I hope this letter finds you in good health. I wanted to share some important advice about maintaining your health. Firstly, it's essential to have a balanced diet. Make sure to include a variety of fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, and whole grains in your meals. Regular exercise is also vital. Aim for at least 30 minutes of physical activity each day. Exercise helps keep your body strong and boosts your immune system.
Remember to stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water throughout the day. Proper hydration is key to maintaining energy levels and overall health. Additionally, ensure you get enough sleep each night. Aim for 7 − 8 7-8 7 − 8 hours of quality sleep to allow your body to rest and recover. Practice good hygiene by washing your hands regularly with soap and water, especially before meals and after coming from toilet. Besides, take time for activities you enjoy, practice mindfulness, and do not hesitate to talk to someone if you are feeling bored. Mental health is just as important as physical health. Lastly, keep up with regular medical check-ups and follow proper diet. Prevention is always better than cure, so stay proactive about your health.
I hope you find these tips helpful. Take care of yourself and stay healthy.
Best wishes,
Sadia

questions.uddipok: Write a dialogue between you and your friend about the recent flood in 2024.

sub_questions.explanation:
About the recent flood in 2024
Saima : Hi Ohana, have you seen the news about the recent flood in Bangladesh?
Ohana : Yes, Saima. It's devastating. Millions of people have been affected.
Saima : I know. The scale of the crisis is terrifying. So many people have lost their homes and belongings.
Ohana : Some took shelter in government-run shelters while some left for their relatives in other cities. But still a great number of families remain trapped in their houses.
Saima : Why aren't they being rescued?
Ohana : The Army, Navy, Fire Service, and other organizations are trying their best to rescue everyone.
Saima : It is hard to imagine the extent of their suffering. There's no electricity, gas or mobile network. The level of water has also damaged a lot of properties. People are running out of their rations and safe drinking water.
Ohana : Thinking about it breaks my heart. But the good news is that the citizens of our country have come forward to help the affected people.
Saima : Definitely. People are supporting relief efforts by donating money, clothes, dry food, medicine and other necessary items with a hope to relieve some of their pain. I would say it is a great example of a teamwork.
Ohana : I agree. We can also help them by donating to organizations that are providing food, shelter, and medical aid.
Saima : Yes, let's do our part to help. It's the least we can do in such difficult times.
